data.name: Yanma
data.flavorText: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.

data.name: Rowlet & Alolan Exeggutor-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Super Growth
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Grass Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. If that Pokémon is now a Stage 1 Pokémon, search your deck for a Stage 2 Pokémon that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Calming Hurricane
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tropical Hour-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all Energy from all of their Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Yanmega
data.flavorText: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes' heads instantly while flying by at high speed.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Celebi
data.flavorText: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

attacks.name: Time Spiral
attacks.text: Devolve 1 of your opponent's evolved Pokémon by removing the highest Stage Evolution card from it. Your opponent shuffles that card into their deck.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Shroomish
data.flavorText: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Sewaddle
data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Sewaddle and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Swadloon
data.flavorText: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Sewaddle
data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Leavanny
data.flavorText: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

abilities.name: Blanket Weaver
abilities.text: Your Grass Pokémon take 40 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Blanket Weaver Ability at a time.

data.name: Crustle
data.flavorText: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 80 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.name: Karrablast
data.flavorText: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Dwebble
data.flavorText: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.

data.name: Foongus
data.flavorText: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Amoonguss
data.flavorText: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.

abilities.name: Bursting Spores
abilities.text: Whenever you play a Pokémon that has the Spore attack from your hand during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Fomantis
data.flavorText: When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Bounsweet
data.flavorText: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it, but it's not intelligent enough to care.

data.name: Lurantis
data.flavorText: For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sol Slice
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached to it, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Steenee
data.flavorText: It's protected by its hard sepals, so it plays with bird Pokémon without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn't care.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Tsareena
data.flavorText: A master of grand and beautiful kicks, it can knock out even kickboxing champions with a single blow.

abilities.name: Queenly Reward
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Grass Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Magmortar
data.flavorText: There are still quite a few factories that rely on the flames provided by Magmortar to process metals.

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Dhelmise
data.flavorText: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.

attacks.name: Sea Creeper Net
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Numel
data.flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Heatran-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Burning Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to become your Active Pokémon, you may move any number of Fire Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

attacks.name: Hot Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Camerupt
data.flavorText: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years—or whenever it becomes really angry.

attacks.name: Strong Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

attacks.name: Victory Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards of different types and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Chandelure
data.flavorText: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

attacks.name: Spirit Burner
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 more damage for each Pokémon you discarded in this way. Then, put any number of Fire Pokémon you discarded in this way onto your Bench.

data.name: Lampent
data.flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Fletchinder
data.flavorText: It scatters embers in the tall grass. Then bug Pokémon, frightened by the flames, come flying out, and Fletchinder gobbles them up.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Talonflame
data.flavorText: Its tough wings don't allow fire to pass through them. A long time ago, firefighters' outfits were made from Talonflame wings.

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flare Raid
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.

data.name: Slowpoke & Psyduck-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ditch and Splash
attacks.text: Discard any number of Supporter cards from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Thrilling Times-GX
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage. If this Pokémon has at least 6 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), flip 10 coins instead, and this attack does 100 more damage for each heads. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it's an important means of transportation over water.

abilities.name: Mermaid's Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Misty's Favor card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It's only able to survive in a limited number of places in the warm Alola region.

data.name: Froslass
data.flavorText: It freezes hikers who have come to climb snowy mountains and carries them back to its home. It only goes after men it thinks are handsome.

attacks.name: Spiteful Sigh
attacks.text: Put up to 7 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Finneon
data.flavorText: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They're popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.

data.name: Snover
data.flavorText: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Lumineon
data.flavorText: Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with Lanturn over food.

attacks.name: Neon Trickery
attacks.text: You may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Tirtouga
data.flavorText: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Tirtouga lived in the sea but came up onto the land to search for prey.

data.name: Abomasnow
data.flavorText: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as "The Ice Monster."

attacks.name: Quick Freeze
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Basculin
data.flavorText: Savage, violent Pokémon, red and blue Basculin are always fighting each other over territory.

attacks.name: Swarming Bites
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Basculin you have in play to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Cryogonal
data.flavorText: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

attacks.name: Frozen Lock
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.name: Keldeo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Pure Heart
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Resolute Blade-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.

data.name: Carracosta
data.flavorText: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.

abilities.name: Ancient Custom
abilities.text: Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon have no effect.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Araquanid
data.flavorText: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sticky Web
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Golisopod
data.flavorText: The shell covering its body is as hard as diamond. This Pokémon will do anything it takes to win.

abilities.name: Emergency Exit
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has 2 or fewer Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Pyukumuku
data.flavorText: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Raichu & Alolan Raichu-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tandem Shock
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 80 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Ride-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tapu Fini
data.flavorText: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

attacks.name: Nature Wave
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Ultra Beasts in play, this attack can be used for Colorless.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

attacks.name: Meal Time
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw a card.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

data.name: Alolan Raichu
data.flavorText: It focuses psychic energy into its tail and rides it like it's surfing. Another name for this Pokémon is "hodad."

attacks.name: Electro Rain
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. Then, for each Energy you discarded in this way, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and do 30 damage to it. (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once.) This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Magnezone
data.flavorText: It uses radar to monitor its territory. Intruders are quickly disposed of with a hyper beam.

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Lightning and Metal type.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bolt
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

attacks.name: Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

attacks.name: Live Wire
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Also apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

attacks.name: Generate Electricity
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

attacks.name: Overspark
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

attacks.name: Wild River
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Eelektross
data.flavorText: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

abilities.name: Electric Swamp
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your hand and you have at least 4 Lightning Energy cards in play, you may play this Pokémon onto your Bench. If you do, move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hover Over
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Thundurus
data.flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Thunderous Gale
attacks.text: If Tornadus is on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Stunfisk
data.flavorText: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

attacks.name: Trap Bolt
attacks.text: If, before doing damage, your opponent's Active Pokémon has more remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Tapu Koko
data.flavorText: Although it's called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

attacks.name: Nature Dive
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, this attack does 100 more damage, and discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Xurkitree
data.flavorText: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

attacks.name: Three Mirrors
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Mewtwo & Mew-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Perfection
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX on your Bench or in your discard pile. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Miraculous Duo-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one of the six be lost, the next morning there will once more be six.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Espeon & Deoxys-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psychic Club
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Psychic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cross Division-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), put 20 damage counters on them instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Exeggutor
data.flavorText: It engages its enemies using psychic powers. Each of its three heads fires off psychokinetic energy, tripling its power.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Full Clean
attacks.text: Discard your hand.

data.name: Alolan Marowak
data.flavorText: The rich greenery of the Alola region is hard on Marowak. It controls fire to stay alive.

attacks.name: Spirit Smash
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If the card you discarded is a Pokémon, this attack does damage equal to that Pokémon's HP to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Jynx
data.flavorText: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.

abilities.name: Ominous Posture
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Attract Smack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Latios-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Bind
abilities.text: If you have 4 or fewer Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Tag Purge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from TAG TEAM Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clear Vision-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your opponent can't use any GX attacks. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Wynaut
data.flavorText: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.

abilities.name: Peppy Pick
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.name: Jirachi-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Zone
abilities.text: Don't apply Psychic Weakness when Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) take damage from attacks.

attacks.name: Star Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Star Shield-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: Its round body is stuffed with souls and expands each time it leads someone away.

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: There's a rumor that if you catch a Drifblim floating on the wind at dusk, you'll be carried away to the afterlife.

abilities.name: Tag Transport
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active TAG TEAM Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Uxie
data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Knowledge." It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

abilities.name: Secret Territory
abilities.text: If you have Mesprit and Azelf in play, apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×4 instead.

data.name: Mesprit
data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Emotion." It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

attacks.name: First Contact
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Skorupi
data.flavorText: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Azelf
data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Willpower." It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Giratina
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

abilities.name: Dimension Breach
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fade to Black
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cresselia
data.flavorText: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Aurora Gain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Luminous Blade
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Munna
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

attacks.name: Lucky Find
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Elgyem
data.flavorText: It controls tremendous psychic power. Most reports of alien sightings are actually just people mistaking Elgyem for an alien.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Musharna
data.flavorText: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rest Well
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep. During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 100 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Beheeyem
data.flavorText: With its psychic powers, it rewrites its opponents' memories. You, too, may have already had your memories rewritten.

attacks.name: Mysterious Noise
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.name: Doublade
data.flavorText: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.

attacks.name: Slashing Cutter
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

attacks.name: Slashing Cutter
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Aegislash
data.flavorText: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

abilities.name: Durable Blade
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile. (Discard all cards attached to it.)

attacks.name: Trash Slash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each Item card in your discard pile. You can't do more than 130 damage in this way.

data.name: Mareanie
data.flavorText: They eat Corsola branches, so Mareanie are hated by craftsmen who work with Corsola branches that have naturally fallen off.

data.name: Toxapex
data.flavorText: To attack, this Pokémon sends toxic spikes flying at its enemies. Ones that come close get mown down by the claws on its feet.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

data.name: Cosmog
data.flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

data.name: Necrozma
data.flavorText: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It's apparently from another world.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Special Laser
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Poipole
data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

attacks.name: Last Scene
attacks.text: If each player has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 130 more damage.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

attacks.name: Bedrock Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Cubone
data.flavorText: At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother, but those cries only attract its natural enemy—Mandibuzz.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

attacks.name: Ground Stream
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gigaton Shake
attacks.text: During your next turn, your Pokémon can't attack. (This includes Pokémon that come into play on that turn.)

data.name: Aerodactyl-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Primal Winds
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

attacks.name: Wild Dive-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: It's proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it's always fighting with.

attacks.name: Turn the Tables
attacks.text: If 1 of your opponent's Pokémon used a GX attack during their last turn, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck.

data.name: Meditite
data.flavorText: It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates when it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.

attacks.name: Spirited Headbutt
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Spirited Headbutt during your next turn.

data.name: Medicham
data.flavorText: It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the same motion.

attacks.name: Pure Power
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Master Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Karate Belt card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Breloom
data.flavorText: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pre-Dawn Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Relicanth
data.flavorText: Thought to have gone extinct, Relicanth was given a name that is a variation of the name of the person who discovered it.

attacks.name: Deep Sea Boring
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Gabite
data.flavorText: It loves shiny things. When it finds a Sableye trying to catch a Carbink, Gabite becomes furiously angry and attacks the Sableye.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

data.name: Gible
data.flavorText: It reacts to anything that moves—flies right at it and bites it. Sometimes it injures itself, but it doesn't care too much.

data.name: Garchomp
data.flavorText: It flies at the speed of sound while searching for prey, and it has midair battles with Salamence as the two compete for food.

abilities.name: Avenging Aura
abilities.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this Pokémon's attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Over Slice
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: It concentrates its mental energy and fires off mysterious waves called auras, which can crush boulders of large size to dust.

abilities.name: Tag Coach
abilities.text: Your TAG TEAM Pokémon take 20 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Drilbur
data.flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle 4 cards from your discard pile into your deck.

data.name: Archen
data.flavorText: Once thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon, some of the latest research suggests that may not be the case.

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Archeops
data.flavorText: This ancient Pokémon's plumage is delicate, so if anyone other than an experienced professional tries to restore it, they will fail.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Terrakion
data.flavorText: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.

attacks.name: Cavern Counter
attacks.text: If all of your Benched Pokémon have at least 1 damage counter on them, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.name: Meloetta
data.flavorText: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

attacks.name: Tag Cheer
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your TAG TEAM Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shooting Star Pirouette
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Zygarde
data.flavorText: This is Zygarde when about 10% of its pieces have been assembled. It leaps at its opponent's chest and sinks its sharp fangs into them.

abilities.name: Cellular Companions
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Zygarde's and Zygarde-GX's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Boost Fang
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Grimer
data.flavorText: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Honchkrow
data.flavorText: It will absolutely not forgive failure from or betrayal by its goons. It has no choice in this if it wants to maintain the order of the flock.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: They will cooperate to steal eggs from the nests of bird Pokémon, but fights break out to determine which one gets to eat the eggs.

data.name: Weavile-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadow Connection
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Darkness Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nocturnal Maneuvers-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Escavalier
data.flavorText: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

attacks.name: Discerning Spear
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has no damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Umbreon & Darkrai-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Black Lance
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX or Benched Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Moon-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn. If this Pokémon has at least 5 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Murkrow
data.flavorText: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

data.name: Purrloin
data.flavorText: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Cleaning Up
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Liepard
data.flavorText: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

attacks.name: Shadow Scratch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: They move in small groups, walking around lazily. Anyone who makes eye contact gets smacked with a headbutt.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Yveltal
data.flavorText: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

attacks.name: Blow Through
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Shadow Impact
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Hoopa
data.flavorText: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.

attacks.name: Evil Admonition
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon that has an Ability.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: It digs through the ground with its hard claws and crunches down gems with its thick pointy teeth. Carbink is its favorite food.

attacks.name: Mirror Gem
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Scrafty
data.flavorText: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.

attacks.name: Turf Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your remaining Prize cards.

data.name: Dedenne
data.flavorText: It sneaks into people's homes and steals electricity from their outlets. When your electric bill seems off, it's the handiwork of this rascal.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Mawile-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Captivating Wink
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may have your opponent reveal their hand and put any number of Basic Pokémon you find there onto their Bench.

attacks.name: Wily Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eater-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard all Supporter cards you find there. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Mega Sableye & Tyranitar-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Greedy Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Gigafall-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 5 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard the top 15 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Murkrow
data.flavorText: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Drapion
data.flavorText: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.

attacks.name: Cross Poison
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads. If at least 2 of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Garchomp & Giratina-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Calamitous Slash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: GG End-GX
attacks.text: Discard 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and all cards attached to it. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fighting Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard 2 of your opponent's Pokémon instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can't move as well.

attacks.name: Dust Gathering
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Whimsicott
data.flavorText: This nuisance sneaks into people's homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.

abilities.name: Prowl
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Dragonair
data.flavorText: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.

attacks.name: Destructive Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Dragonite
data.flavorText: It flies over raging seas as if they were nothing. Observing this, a ship's captain dubbed this Pokémon "the sea incarnate."

abilities.name: Hurricane Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card, a Lightning Energy card, or 1 of each from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Dragon Impact
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Dragonair
data.flavorText: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Dragonite-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Judgment
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mach Delivery-GX
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand until you have 9 or fewer. Draw cards until you have 10 cards in your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Fraxure
data.flavorText: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Noibat
data.flavorText: Fruits are its favorite foods. This gourmet carefully picks out just the ripe ones using its sonar.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Hoothoot
data.flavorText: Every day, it tilts its head in the same rhythm. A long time ago, people raised these Pokémon to serve as clocks.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Slakoth
data.flavorText: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Bidoof
data.flavorText: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Pidove
data.flavorText: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.

data.name: Slakoth
data.flavorText: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.

attacks.name: Lazy Howl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if they attach an Energy card from their hand to the Defending Pokémon, their turn ends.

data.name: Yungoos
data.flavorText: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It's a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.

data.name: Oranguru
data.flavorText: It normally spends its time meditating in the treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other Pokémon orders as it pleases.

attacks.name: Sage's Riddle
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon from your hand face down in front of you. Your opponent guesses the type of that Pokémon, and then you reveal it. If your opponent guessed right, they draw 4 cards. If they guessed wrong, you draw 4 cards. Return the Pokémon to your hand.

data.name: Unfezant
data.flavorText: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.

attacks.name: Downburst
attacks.text: You may have each player shuffle all cards attached to their Active Pokémon into their deck.

data.name: Gumshoos
data.flavorText: Although it wasn't originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.

attacks.name: Alert Headbutt
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this attack's base damage is 30.

data.name: Haxorus
data.flavorText: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.

abilities.name: Grind Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, attach up to 3 in any combination of Fire and Metal Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Powerful Axe
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage times the amount of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Druddigon
data.flavorText: The red skin on its face is harder than rock. In narrow caves, it squares off against its enemies and charges face-first right into them.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.name: Naganadel-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Conversion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Ultra Beast card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Venom Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Injection-GX
attacks.text: Add a card from your opponent's discard pile to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Kangaskhan
data.flavorText: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those who harm its child and will beat them down.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Tag Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your TAG TEAM Pokémon in play.

data.name: Tauros
data.flavorText: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Berserker Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Latias
data.flavorText: It communicates using telepathy. Its body is covered in down that refracts light to make it invisible.

attacks.name: Energy Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to that Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Axew
data.flavorText: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

abilities.name: Unnerve
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Noivern
data.flavorText: Although it has a violent disposition, if you give it a nice ripe fruit that it loves, Noivern will suddenly become tame.

attacks.name: Boomburst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

data.name: Lickitung
data.flavorText: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!

attacks.name: Heavy Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card for each of your Pokémon in play that has a Retreat Cost of exactly 4.

data.name: Lickilicky
data.flavorText: A contest is under way to determine which one can stick its tongue out the farthest. The current record is…more than 82 feet.

attacks.name: Licks Go Crazy
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand, discard the top card of your opponent's deck, and discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Slaking
data.flavorText: The world's laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there's no food left within its reach.

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamic Swing
attacks.text: You may do 100 more damage. If you do, during your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Bibarel
data.flavorText: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Tranquill
data.flavorText: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Audino
data.flavorText: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

abilities.name: Hearing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Drain Slap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Noctowl
data.flavorText: With eyes that can see in pitch-darkness, it never lets its prey escape. Some even call it "the emperor of dark nights."

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Vigoroth
data.flavorText: Its heartbeat is fast and its blood so agitated that it can't sit still for one second.

attacks.name: Roar

attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Injection-GX
attacks.text: Add a card from your opponent's discard pile to their Prize cards face down. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: U-Turn Board
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is Colorless less.
If this card is discarded from play, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Viridian Forest
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a card from their hand. If they do, that player searches their deck for a basic Energy card, reveals it, and puts it into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Garchomp & Giratina-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Calamitous Slash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: GG End-GX
attacks.text: Discard 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and all cards attached to it. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fighting Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), discard 2 of your opponent's Pokémon instead. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Recycle Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
If this card is discarded from play, put it into your hand instead of the discard pile.

data.name: Weakness Guard Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.

data.name: Cherish Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Reset Stamp
rules: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Jirachi-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Zone
abilities.text: Don't apply Psychic Weakness when Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) take damage from attacks.

attacks.name: Star Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Psychic Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Star Shield-GX
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
